author: Sasha and the cats
text: "So I read all of the recent reviews.  I noticed that either people love or hate this place.  I admit I am a customer from over 15 years ago
column5: and I loved this place.  Despite the recent negative reviews I decided to give them a try again.  Honestly I won't be coming back.  To be fair it's not because Arthur's is horrible or 1 star like some people have rated them.  It's because there are simply better places to go now that offer better food at a better value.  To be honest
column6: you are better off going to Outback steakhouse.  You will get a better steak
column9: and better service.\n\nArthurs trimmed down there menu
column10: it is 2 steak choices and I think a burger.  If you come here it's for steak.  The steak is large and a ribeye.  The steak was salty which I have never experienced before.  Not sure how they did that
column11: salted butter or salt seasoning?  Way to salty
column12: and I like salt.  Garlic bread was good
column16: but we noticed our neighbors waitress wasn't to friendly.  Overall
column21: $150 bill.  For that price like I said
column28: cheaper bill.  Sad cause I used to love this place.  It's not 1 star
column29: but not worth the trip or price."

text: 'Steak and potatoes not as good as I remembered in the past years. Priced at $44.00 not exactly reasonable and only one choice on the steak very disappointing! Potatoes were edible. Waitress was great though they were obviously stressed out and trying to keep a positive attitude. Overall not a great dining experience. I took my niece for her birthday and I was embarrassed to even suggest it.'

author: Francois Frites
text:
'One of the best if not the best place for a good steak and french onion soup.
Deserving of a 4.5 based on price and quality.
I've been going here for over 20 years!

I remember when they had the 24oz steak for around $24 and the quality was fantastic. Definitely something to take home and make a stew the next day.
I still think the lunch menu is a great deal!
Where in the NYC area can you get a high quality steak for under $37 these days?
The same steaks sell in fine dining Steakhouses for $50-60!

It's really hard to tell the difference between these top steakhouses and Arthur's because they get very similar "if not" the same quality cut!'

author: jenny nieves
text: "Not going back....I been going to this place for many many years. My husband decided to treat himself for a steak for his ( BD). He order the a medium steak and received and medium rare steak.üò´ I order the two crabcakes with a side of corn salsa and asparagus. For almost $25 i thought i would be served two decent size crabcakes a nice portion of the corn salsa and asparagus. Instead the corn was scatter around my plates as garnished with two stalks of asparagus. I thought it was a bad joke....seriously charging me that price for two small capcake so return the dish. The waitress was very pleasant and offer me something else from the menu. I decided to go with the salad and told her i didn't want the blue cheese. She asked me if i wanted to swap for another cheese like fresh mozzarella. I asked her if it was an extra charge. She responded no because it was a swap of just cheese. When we got the bill we notice the xtra charge for the cheese. My husband approached the  manager and told her about the conversation i had with the waitress about the no extra charge but she responded that they don't do those kind of swaps. The manager seemed very bother and upset and took the xtra charged off. Time to look for another steak house!!"

"(Translated by Google) Food guide for Koreans;
A restaurant where I stopped by after chatting while watching the night view of Manhattan from Hoboken.
I remember being there at the deadline. What a delicious and kind staff‚ù£Ô∏è
New Jersey is certainly not a few distances from Manhattan. I can't remember Brad's name
column5:
but it was so delicious. Same with meat!! Best recommended!!

author: Disc Mogul
text: 'As they say
column5: the steak was on point!'

author: Jess
text: "I've been to a ton of steakhouses and Arthur's had always been my favorite. If you go there
column5: I highly recommend getting the Arthur's (our) steak. Perfectly grilled and delicious potatoes come with it. I've never sat upfront but I always sit in the back. The complaint I have is the chairs feel so old. Like
column6: If you move it feels like they will collapse. It makes sitting there for an extended period uncomfortable. Besides that though

author: sir epii
text: "Make sure u order medium well for medium. Ribeye Steak came raw for medium. No flavor. Asparagus was still raw. It was 4 of us and all orders weren't what we were expecting. Order the burger instead."

author: lauren d
text:
'Review copied from my yelp

THIS PLACE HAS MICE. AND NOW THEY ARE IGNORING ME.
Firstly
column5: let me say that my name is Matt and I am posting on my gfs account bc I don‚Äôt have a yelp account
column6: so if the restaurant reads this they can‚Äôt say that they never dealt with me bc it‚Äôs posted under a women‚Äôs name.\n\nI‚Äôve been so patient in dealing with this place. This incident happened on Feb 13 and I‚Äôve been dealing with this since that night..until now that I‚Äôve been completely ignored by management. Now
column7: I am not only disgusted with the issue itself but also with the way this issue has been neglected.\n\nI Came here with a friend to celebrate a work promotion
column8: I‚Äôm so embarrassed I suggested this place to him as he had never been here before and I raved about the food. I‚Äôve been coming here for years and years with family
column11: etc. I‚Äôve never had a bad meal or had any issue before.\n\nWe had just finished eating and paid the bill
column12: the check was still sitting on the table. Something caught my eye running between the tables. There were mice. I actually didn‚Äôt believe it at first so got up from my table and shined the light of my phone into the corner and there they were. I sat back down so grossed out that I just ate dinner and saw this. As the waitress passed by to see if we were taking out leftovers home I explained what I saw. She was not shocked at all. She offered to get a manager to come over to speak to us. Alexa was acting manager this night
column14: offered us a drink on the house and a gift card for a future meal... I had just seen mice in and around the bar area and running between table
column15: I‚Äôm not drinking or eating anything in its vicinity. Alexa flat out told us they aware of the issue "They come in from outside" she said... Well obviously you‚Äôre not ordering them in from your meat distributor. She offered to have Dave call me when he was in the next day which he did. I was at work and couldn‚Äôt get to the phone fast enough
column16: missed the call. I called back later that day. Someone answered
column17: I asked for Dave. They said hold on. Then came back to the phone and asked who I was. Once I said it was Matt they told me he isn‚Äôt here now. That was my first red flag. Why put me on hold to go get Dave but then when I say whose on the phone Dave suddenly isn‚Äôt there?? That was my first red flag that was being ignored.\n\nI‚Äôve since called back a handful of times. I‚Äôve been dealing with Vera now
column18: who insists that she‚Äôs been emailing the guy who does the credit card transactions to get me a refund... this has been ongoing for what will be exactly a month tomorrow with no resolve in sight.\n\nThe way they were so nonchalant when we told there were mice was running by the tables and bar should have been an indication as to how the rest of the story would go. NEVER in all the years I‚Äôve been coming here did I think this restaurant would be the kind of establishment to ignore a patron and make no attempt to right their wrong.  If you know you have a problem how do you not get an exterminator to come in as often as you need to so you can ensure this stops. If vermin is comfortable hanging out in the dining room I cant imagine what\'s going on in the kitchen. I‚Äôve been letting this go on for a month
column19: hoping it would be resolved privately. I‚Äôm sure my review will get me nowhere with them now
column20: but this place is being reported to the health department....NEVER AGAIN.'

author: Victor Wright
text: 'The food was great'

author: Hasan Ozmulla
text: 'Great steak and great beer!!'

author: Don Perrier
text: 'The house stake special was great 25 years ago and is as good today.'

author: Andrew Z
text: 'We have been going here for 20 years. As some have mentioned the food quality has gone down. Gine there twice in the last year and was disappointed. This place was our favorite steakhouse. I tjink the loc as ls have figured it out as well. The place wad almost empty on a college foodball Saturday.'

author: Norbert M
text: 'Very good steakhouse.'

author: Joel Alanis
text: 'The "Our Steak" was the main event and it did not disappoint. The sides where alright
column5: but the 24 oz. steak was fantastic Juicy on the inside with a nice sear and char on the outside.'

author: Queen Hiwat (Queen)
text: 'Love it excellent customer service'

author: Howard Stein
text: 'Good steak at a good price'

author: Nicole Quick Dawson
text: 'Great spot with EXCELLENT food and service'

author: Joe Goritschnig
text: "The steak was okay nothing to write home about
column5: onion soup was good
column6: but the place is way overpriced.\nI used to go to Arthur at least once a week 15 to 20 years ago
column7: but not in the last 10 years. I figured I'd give it another try but it was a one-time thing"

author: Eisen Jo Casaclang
text: 'Ample servings'

author: Nick Martella
text: 'Been going here for the past 5 years and food quality has gone downhill each year. The surf and turf steak was incorrectly cooked even though it had a Rare plastic marker stuck into it. Cheap drinks and garlic bread save this place from 0 stars.'

author: Ra'Myia Odoms
text: 'My favorite steak house since I was a kid. My grandfather loved this place üòä'

author: Diana Suso
text: 'Food was good too pricey'

author: Rich M
text: 'Always a solid burger choice.'

author: Bucky Potter
text: 'Really enjoyed the food. Parking a little difficult.'

author: Ron Me
text: 'Was my favorite restaurant until the big price hike.'

author: donna christina
text: 'Steaks are great
column5: not to mention those potatoes.  Chili is very good the entire menu is very delicious
column6: making decisions very hard'

author: addis duttonto
text: 'Always good'

author: Moises Viteri (MOU)
text:
'(Translated by Google) Excellent to spend in family and eat roasted meat with different types of cuts.

(Original)
Excelente para pasar en familia y comer carne asada con diferentes tipos de cortes.'

author: Goya Ramirez-Ortega
text: 'Great'

author: Mitchell Ruby
text: 'Great seafood! I had the salmon with garlic butter over salad and my boyfriend had the fried shrimp and fish with a side of gumbo. We also ordered the ceviche. Both meals were great. I especially loved the gumbo and my boyfriend loves the ceviche. I will be back!'

author: Toni Gisondi
text: 'One of the best in the area. The potatoes and steak are the go-to for a great dinner.'

author: Agan Singh
text: 'Standard steak and burger place. The restaurant decor is a bit dated but all the workers are very friendly. I had the surf and turf which was good. Come on Wednesdays if you have a kid. You get a kids meal free with the purchase of an adult entree.'

author: Lou Kenneth Isip
text: 'Always great here. Steak is never done wrong and always accommodates my usual party of 8-11. The service is usually good. Only issue is probably the kids Mac and cheese. I‚Äôm almost positive it‚Äôs from a Kraft box.'

author: Mordy Naftaly
text: 'They are great'

author: Christina Swoyer
text: "My husband and I went here last night and were disappointed. I've been here multiple times before but this will likely keep us away for a while. We got a soup which was luke warm and both got burgers. The burgers were cooked as we asked and weren't bad but they were extremely greasy tasting which left me feeling less then great the rest of the night. Service was good but food left much to be desired."

author: Mike Argandona
text: 'Great place... gem of a place'

author: George Martin
text: "Very good steakhouse. I think it's the best steak for the money you'll find in the area. Frankly
column5: though
column6: I think the quality has diminished a bit in recent years
column7: which is a shame. Still very
column8: very good...I just think it used to be better.\n\nI still visit this restaurant almost monthly. It's a great place for a night out with friends if you're craving steak."

author: Rudy Hernandez
text: 'Great steak and the mash potatoes are amazing!'

author: Peter DeFeo
text: 'Havent been here in years
column5: great laid back spot to enjoy an great steak at a great price. Has the famous (our steak) and it was cooked to perfection
column6: garlic bread was out of this world. Other party goes had the ribswhich were also delicious. Definitely would recommend this placefor lunch or dinner.'

author: Robert Cook
text: 'Stake was a little fatty for me‚òπ'

author: Zvi Livne
text:
"(Translated by Google) The place is nice for those looking for a great steak at a reasonable price. In the Hoboken neighborhood. You can stop on the way from Jersey Garden
The steak is fried and not roasted and I am less connected.
The potatoes were with a lot of oil and left heartburn.
Delicious onion soup.
The service is fast.

author: max mouris
text: 'Over rated. It might be one of the oldest in Honoken. But its days have gone. Food is low quality
column5: with steak house prices. Service and ambience is mediocre at best. Would not recommend it.'

author: Ekaterina Skulskaia
text: 'The steaks are not as good as they used to be.'

author: Michael Pizza
text: 'Good steak for the money. Good service as well.'

author: Nong Ch.
text: '‚ÄúOur steak‚Äù is 24-oz ribeye steak on its menu which we had. It is very good
column5: but some part is a bit tiny tough...still delicious.Their famous garlic bread is earned its fame. We went on Sat for lunch. The service is good. The staff is very nice and professional explaining the menu. Steak on a rainy day
column6: what more you can ask for :)'

author: michael powers
text: 'Great steak. Nice casual atmosphere.'

author: Morales
text: 'This place is the bees knees! Great steaks and potatoes for a great price.  The beverage sizes are great for parties and outings. I will recommend this place to anyone in the area looking for a good steak and will definitely revisit. My mouth waters just thinking if their steak lol'

author: Lisa Hoskins
text: 'This is an incredible steakhouse! Burgers and salads are great too. This is a favorite place for me and my husband. We like bringing out of town guests here. They have a large dining room with a bar in the back
column5: and a cozy
column6: beautiful dining room in the front.'

author: Chef Vee
text: 'Excellent'

author: Jeremy Rivera
text: "Food was good
column5: staff is friendly. Kinda expensive for the style of the location. Crabcakes was not as hot as they looked. They definitely don't take plating into consideration
column6: steak and potatoes looks like it was slapped on. Environment needs a makeover."

author: Rossy Torres
text: 'Best steak ever'

author: David Gozdieski
text: 'Just the best steak around'

author: Jesse Campbell
text: "I've been going to Arthur's for 20years now. It still has a very traditional steak house feel. The steak is not as good as it used to be and the potatoes are different in a way that's hard to explain but not for the better. It's really a 3.5 star steak house."

author: Chris Frie
text: 'Authentic steakhouse'

author: Genny Ortiz
text: 'Best steak ever'

author: Giorgio Rosi
text: 'Great food and great service !! The ribs are amazing and the " our burger " is always really good!.'

author: Robert MILLER
text: 'Been going to Arthur Steakhouse for 30 years still love it.'

author: Duwana Johson
text: "Yum I can't  wait  to go back!!!!!"

author: Frank
text: "Best steakhouse I have ever been to. I can't order steak anywhere else after having the one they make here. Their steak makes other places look bad."

author: Moyshik Efodi
text: 'Very good Ribeye.\n24oz ribeye
column5: Bier
column6: potatoes and pickles.\n52$ include tip.'

author: Mark Johnson
text: 'Top of the line steakhouse'

author: Tharsan Bhuvanendran
text: 'Steak was alright
column5: but not worth the cost. Service could definitely be improved.'

author: Thomas Micol
text: 'The best steak you can have in New Jersey'

author: john cunning
text: 'Always very good'

author: GuyZa
text: 'Not as good as it used to be
column5: the service was inattentive even sloppy
column6: the steaks were not realy that good
column7: i have been going there for many years now and it seems that something not good is happening to the place'

author: Christian Dirscherl
text:
'(Translated by Google) Great meat ... a lot of meat

(Original)
Geiles Fleisch......viel Fleisch'

author: Rony Garces
text: 'Good steak'

author: Matt Frank
text: 'Great Filet Mignon.'

author: ÍπÄÏÜ°ÏùÄ
text: 'Dinner for 2.  50 dollars.  We ordered for medium rare but it was overcooked. Sirloin was pretty good and shrimp was the best. Steaks were little bit salty'

author: Gail Judd
text: "One of the best steaks I've ever had and the prices are reasonable"

author: Marco W
text: 'Phenomenal. The steak was delicious and juicy. Burger cooked just right. Side dishes were tasty and cooked to perfection. Beers were the right temperature
column5: frosty. Waiter was friendly and dressed in costume for the holiday. Perfect night. Definitely recommend'

author: Marie
text: 'The steak was absolutely delicious!!!'

author: Steven Villafane
text: 'Food and service was exceptional'

author: Alex Clower
text: "Good steak and burger place. Prices are typical Hoboken
column5: not too expensive and quality is average. Service is pleasant and prompt. Overall
column6: don't expect exceptional food but it's ok for a meal with friends."

author: Blue Dawg
text: '‚ÄúOUR STEAK‚Äù is an absolute must.   It is our favorite meal to order every time as well as the French onion soup.     If you‚Äôre really hungry the garlic bread is always delicious and hot.  We also love to nibble on the pickles
column5: they‚Äôre great too.  Service is outstanding.  Never had an issue.  Food is served promptly
column6: never have to wait even for drink refills.'

author: Riol Matamoros
text: 'Excellent food'

author: alex cede√±o
text: 'Great food
column5: the steak was awesome!'

author: Herb M
text: 'Good food and nice environment. A bit pricey'

author: douglas quinonez
text: 'The steak was very tender and tasty.\nWaitress was attentive
column5: last time I was here  was 10 years ago.\nNice to see somethings never change.'

author: AJ
text: "This place is no high-class steak joint
column5: but that's what makes it so amazing. You gotta get the Arthur steak and a liter beer and you are set. I recently ordered the French onion soup and it was probably the best french onion soup I've had in years. this place is homie and don't forget to ask for the table pickles and the pickled peppers to eat with your steak it's absolutely necessary! Did I forget to mention it's incredibly affordable for a steak joint?"

author: Parker Waterhouse
text: "Great place
column5: gets crowded but many tables. My parents would go there when they lived in Hoboken and now I do when ever I'm in the area. And everybody knows the best stakes are found in Jerset"

author: Rick Scull
text: 'Excellent steaks'

author: K syed
text: "Very good steak
column5: decent decor and atmosphere though sport bar-esque (tv is always playing at least one game). Although they have other things in the menu
column6: if don't like eating steak probably not the best place for you to go."

author: Josh Vance
text: "Excellent house ribeye
column5: was basically perfect. Garlic bread and calimari were each A+. Sangrias were pretty weak though and I didn't care for the potatoes that came with the steak"

author: lj pan
text:
'(Translated by Google) good to eat!

author: rodney xxx
text: 'One of the best juicy steak i have eaten'
